dt: {bc}different from the usual or conventional: such as
{bc}existing or functioning outside the established cultural, social, or economic system
{bc}of, relating to, or being rock music that is regarded as an alternative to conventional rock and is typically influenced by punk rock, hard rock, hip-hop, or folk music
{bc}of, relating to, or being music of a genre other than rock that is similarly regarded as an alternative to the conventional music of that genre

et: borrowed from Middle French & Medieval Latin; Middle French {it}alternatif{/it} "occurring by turns, alternating," borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}alternātīvus,{/it} from Latin {it}alternātus,{/it} past participle of {it}alternāre{/it} "to ebb and flow, act in alternation, arrange in alternating order" + {it}-īvus{/it} {et_link|-ive|-ive} {ma}{mat|alternate:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: different from the usual or conventional: such as
existing or functioning outside the established cultural, social, or economic system
